newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hanil Bank to offer loan to Jinro unit.
newsitem.headline: Hanil Bank to offer loan to Jinro unit.

text.p: Hanil Bank said on Saturday it had decided to offer five billion won in emergency loans to Jinro General Foods Co, a unit of the Jinro Group.
The decision came after the group's chairman Chang Jin-ho, who is the largest shareholder in the food maker, promised to let creditor banks sell off his stake, a Hanil spokesman said.
He said Chang and his family currently had a combined stake of 14 percent in Jinro General Foods.
The Jinro Group has been in financial trouble and was selected for bail-out in April by creditor banks.
